entry.title: Bitcoin Core 28.1 Release Candidate 2 Available
entry.summary:
The latest binaries for Bitcoin Core version v28.1rc2 are now accessible, offering the community an opportunity to engage with this new major version release candidate. Those interested can download the binaries from [Bitcoin Core's official site](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-28.1/test.rc2/). Furthermore, the source code is readily available for review on GitHub, under the signed tag found at [this GitHub link](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/tree/v28.1rc2). Such transparency and availability are crucial for ensuring the reliability and security of the software.
As part of the pre-release process, preliminary release notes have been published to provide users and developers with insights into the changes and improvements included in this version. These notes can be explored in detail [here](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/v28.1rc2/doc/release-notes.md), highlighting the project's commitment to openness and informed user engagement.
Release candidates serve a pivotal role in the development cycle, acting as test versions that precede the final release. The core team closely monitors feedback and bug reports during this phase. Assuming no critical issues emerge, this candidate will advance to become the official v28.1 release. This iterative process underscores the project's dedication to quality and stability.
This update was disseminated through the Bitcoin Development Mailing List, reflecting the project's ongoing efforts to keep its community informed and involved. Subscribers to this list receive timely updates about such significant milestones, ensuring they remain at the forefront of developments within the Bitcoin Core project.
